title: Advanced State Management (NgRx)
subject: Angular
theory: NgRx is the Angular implementation of the Redux pattern. It provides a single source of truth (Store) using explicit Actions to trigger state changes via pure functions called Reducers. Effects handle side effects (API calls).

examples.explanation: State is immutable. The reducer takes old state + action and returns new state.

common_mistakes.correction: Not every app needs Redux. It adds boilerplate. Use it for complex, shared state.
common_mistakes.example: Using NgRx for a simple toggle button.

interview_questions.question: What is the role of Effects in NgRx?
interview_questions.answer: Effects listen for actions, perform side effects (like HTTP calls) and dispatch new actions (success/fail) back to the store, keeping components pure.

real_world_use_cases.description: Cart state must be consistent across header, checkout, and inventory pages.

summary: NgRx provides predictability and debugging power (Time Travel) for large enterprise apps.
